body_html:
Hi again, sorry for late response, I was not able to access the machine.
@sandipmgiri I exported the CC_OPT_FLAGS and verified it is valid by echo $CC_OPT_FLAGS. It doesn't seem to help. I get the same error, i.e.

ERROR: /home/powerpc/.cache/bazel/_bazel_powerpc/7ad07c846e34c4f733a905eaa47f3cba/external/gif_archive/BUILD.bazel:8:1: C++ compilation of rule '@gif_archive//:gif' failed (Exit 1).
gcc: error: unrecognized command line option '-march=native'
Target //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package failed to build
Use --verbose_failures to see the command lines of failed build steps.

I get these errors for gif_arcive, protobuf, highwayhash for different trials.
By the way, I switched to bazel 0.5.4 before trying exporting CC_OPT_FLAGS, since it is recommended for tensorflow, would that affect?

EDIT:
@gunan I also tried --copts="-mcpu=native" but got the following,

ERROR: Unrecognized option: --copts=-mcpu=native
Is --copts option valid only for bazel 0.7.0? In case, I can switch to 0.7.0 and try again.

EDIT2:
@gunan Yeah, little typo over there: --copts="-mcpu=native". It is supposed to be copt. It compiled and ran successfully.

So, as a summary;

  • Tensorflow 1.4.0
  • Bazel 0.7.0
  • Ubuntu 16.04
  • powerpc ppc64le

Using --copt="-mcpu=native" while compiling tensorflow did the trick.

@sandipmgiri At this point I'm not sure why export CC_OPT_FLAGS didn't work.

body:
Hi again, sorry for late response, I was not able to access the machine.
@sandipmgiri I exported the `CC_OPT_FLAGS` and verified it is valid by  `echo $CC_OPT_FLAGS`. It doesn't seem to help. I get the same error, i.e.

`ERROR:` `/home/powerpc/.cache/bazel/_bazel_powerpc/7ad07c846e34c4f733a905eaa47f3cba/external/gif_archive/BUILD.bazel:8:1: C++ compilation of rule '@gif_archive//:gif' failed (Exit 1).`
`gcc: error: unrecognized command line option '-march=native'`
`Target //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package failed to build`
`Use --verbose_failures to see the command lines of failed build steps.`

I get these errors for `gif_arcive`, `protobuf`, `highwayhash` for different trials.
By the way, I switched to bazel 0.5.4 before trying exporting `CC_OPT_FLAGS`, since it is recommended for tensorflow, would that affect?

**EDIT:**
@gunan I also tried `--copts="-mcpu=native"` but got the following,

`ERROR: Unrecognized option: --copts=-mcpu=native`
Is `--copts` option valid only for bazel 0.7.0? In case, I can switch to 0.7.0 and try again.


**EDIT2:**
@gunan Yeah, little typo over there:  `--copts="-mcpu=native"`. It is supposed to be `copt`. It compiled and ran successfully.

So, as a summary;
- **Tensorflow 1.4.0**
- **Bazel 0.7.0**
- **Ubuntu 16.04**
- **powerpc ppc64le**

Using --copt="-mcpu=native" while compiling tensorflow did the trick.

@sandipmgiri At this point I'm not sure why `export CC_OPT_FLAGS` didn't work.
